etymology.description: Pictogram: a bronze bell; in bronze inscriptions the lower part became 用 (OC *loŋs), which serves as a phonetic. Similar but unrelated to 用 and 角.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a bell, with its lower portion later regularized as the graph 用, providing the yǒng sound value in later forms. The likeness to 用 or 角 is only visual, not etymological.

examples.chinese: 这条甬道通向大厅(這條甬道通向大廳)。
examples.english: This passage leads to the main hall.

examples.chinese: 当地人常用“甬”指宁波(當地人常用「甬」指寧波)。
examples.pinyin: Dāngdì rén cháng yòng “Yǒng” zhǐ Níngbō.
examples.english: Locals often use “Yǒng” to refer to Ningbo.

examples.chinese: 参观者沿甬道缓缓前行(參觀者沿甬道緩緩前行)。
examples.english: Visitors proceed slowly along the passageway.
